snippet: The I.R.S. is finally promising to review rules governing the limits of political activity for so-called social welfare nonprofits, many of which are partisan attack dogs.
abstract: Editorial welcomes Internal Revenue Service's decision to review 50-year-old rules governing the limits of political activity for social welfare nonprofits; notes IRS has promised a review of tax exemptions for such organizations after receiving complaints from watchdog groups that have been tracking the ballooning use of the 'social welfare' guise to finance classic hardball politics.
lead_paragraph: The I.R.S. is finally promising to review rules governing the limits of political activity for so-called social welfare nonprofits, many of which are partisan attack dogs.

headline.seo: The I.R.S. Finally Takes On Secret Campaign Donations
